fdd:description.p: Interface format for DV, the Digital Video family of related video encodings (DV, DVCAM, and DVCPRO). A frame of data in the DV format stream is divided into several DIF sequences, each of which is composed of an integral number of 80-byte DIF blocks. DIF blocks are the basic units of DV streams, and each block contains a 3-byte ID header that specifies the block type and its position in the DIF sequence. There are five types of DIF blocks: DIF sequence header, Subcode, Video Auxiliary information (VAUX), Audio, and Video. DV-DIF blocks can be stored as files in raw form (.dv or .dif extension) or wrapped in such file formats as AVI, QuickTime, and MXF.
DV encoding is described in DV. More information on DV-DIF is provided in Notes below. Comments on this format description are welcome.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Interface format for DV, the Digital Video family of related video encodings (DV, DVCAM, and DVCPRO).
fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:productionPhase: Generally a initial-state or middle-state format.

fdd:relatedTo.fdd:titleName: MXF Generic Container Mapped to DV-DIF Data

fdd:relationship.fdd:comment: Other file wrappers, not documented here

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:selfDocumentation: Pertains to the file format; see the subtypes listed above or the wrappers AVI, QuickTime, and MXF.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:externalDependencies: None for files; see DV for information about videocassette applications.
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:techProtection: Pertains to the file format; see the subtypes listed above or the wrappers AVI, QuickTime, and MXF.

fdd:filenameExtension.fdd:note: For unwrapped "raw" files. For wrapped files, see AVI_DV, QTV_DV, and MXF_GC_DV-DIF.

fdd:internetMediaType.fdd:note: For unwrapped "raw" files, from The File Extension Source. For wrapped files, see AVI_DV, QTV_DV, and MXF_GC_DV-DIF.

fdd:general.p: SMPTE 383M (MXF Mapping of DV-DIF to Generic Container) reports that single-frame distributions of DV-DIF data are defined in SMPTE 314M, SMPTE 370M, IEC 61834-2 (for a complete list of specification documents, see DV format specifications). SMPTE 383M (page 2) also reports:

ul.li: For 60-cycle systems, there are ten identical DIF sequences in each DIF channel.
For 50-cycle systems, twelve. Each DIF sequence is assigned to a DIF channel.
For 25 MB/s IEC DV and DV-based compression: one DIF channel.
For 50 MB/s DV-based compression: two channels.
For 100 MB/s DV-based compression: four channels.
